messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 40.0 Unit Celsius
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit Celsius
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Target Temperature
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit Celsius
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius and switch it to heat mode?

First, I identify the commands needed to fulfill the request. The user wants to set the target temperature to 22 °C, which is within the allowed range of 10.0 to 30.0 °C, so the Set Temperature command with parameter 22.0 °C is valid. Next, the user wants to switch the mode to heat, which corresponds to the enum value Heat [1]. The Set Mode command with parameter Heat is appropriate.

Therefore, the assistant should issue two commands: Set Temperature with 22.0 °C and Set Mode with Heat.

Result: Execute Set Temperature (22.0 °C) and Set Mode (Heat) to configure the thermostat as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 40.0 Unit Celsius
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit Celsius
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Target Temperature
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit Celsius
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
What is the current temperature and fan speed of the thermostat?

The user wants to know the current temperature and fan speed properties of the thermostat. According to the device structure, Current Temperature is a property ranging from 5.0 to 40.0 °C, and Fan Speed is an enum with values Low [1], Medium [2], and High [3].

To retrieve these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use the Query Status command to obtain the current temperature and fan speed from the thermostat.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Auto Lock Enabled
      Enum
        True [1]
        False [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Set Auto Lock [SET_AUTO_LOCK]
      Parameter 1: Auto Lock Enabled
        Enum
          True [1]
          False [0]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Please unlock the front door and enable auto lock feature.

The user requests two actions: unlock the door and enable the auto lock feature. The device accepts Unlock Door command without parameters to unlock, and Set Auto Lock command with a parameter to enable or disable auto lock.

First, the Unlock Door command will change Lock Status to Unlocked [0]. Then, Set Auto Lock command with parameter True [1] will enable the auto lock feature.

Result: Execute Unlock Door command followed by Set Auto Lock with parameter True to fulfill the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Auto Lock Enabled
      Enum
        True [1]
        False [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Set Auto Lock [SET_AUTO_LOCK]
      Parameter 1: Auto Lock Enabled
        Enum
          True [1]
          False [0]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
What is the battery level of the door lock and is auto lock enabled?

The user wants to know the Battery Level and whether Auto Lock is enabled. Battery Level is a property ranging from 0 to 100 percent, and Auto Lock Enabled is an enum with True [1] or False [0].

To get these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use Query Status to retrieve Battery Level (0-100%) and Auto Lock Enabled (True/False) from the door lock.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SET_SPEED]
      Parameter 1: Speed Level
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Set Direction [SET_DIR]
      Parameter 1: Direction
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the ceiling fan, set speed to 3, and reverse the direction?

The user wants to turn on the fan, set its speed to 3 (within the allowed 0-5 range), and change the direction to reverse.

First, the Turn On command will set Power Status to On [1]. Next, Set Speed with parameter 3 will adjust the speed level. Finally, Set Direction with parameter Reverse [1] will change the fan's rotation.

Result: Execute Turn On, then Set Speed (3), and Set Direction (Reverse) commands to meet the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SET_SPEED]
      Parameter 1: Speed Level
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Set Direction [SET_DIR]
      Parameter 1: Direction
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
What is the current speed and direction of the ceiling fan?

The user wants to know the current Speed Level and Direction of the ceiling fan. Speed Level is a numeric property from 0 to 5, and Direction is an enum with Forward [0] or Reverse [1].

To obtain these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use Query Status to retrieve the current Speed Level (0-5) and Direction (Forward or Reverse) of the ceiling fan.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 20.0 to 80.0 Unit Celsius
    Target Temperature
      Range 30.0 to 70.0 Unit Celsius
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Consumption
      Range 0.0 to 100.0 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Target Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Target Temperature
        Range 30.0 to 70.0 Unit Celsius
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the water heater and set the target temperature to 55 degrees Celsius.

The user wants to turn on the water heater and set its target temperature to 55 °C, which is within the allowed range of 30.0 to 70.0 °C.

First, the Turn On command will set Power Status to On [1]. Then, the Set Target Temperature command with parameter 55.0 °C will adjust the target temperature.

Result: Execute Turn On command followed by Set Target Temperature (55.0 °C) to fulfill the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 20.0 to 80.0 Unit Celsius
    Target Temperature
      Range 30.0 to 70.0 Unit Celsius
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Consumption
      Range 0.0 to 100.0 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Target Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Target Temperature
        Range 30.0 to 70.0 Unit Celsius
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
What is the current temperature and energy consumption of the water heater?

The user wants to know the Current Temperature and Energy Consumption of the water heater. Current Temperature ranges from 20.0 to 80.0 °C, and Energy Consumption ranges from 0.0 to 100.0 kWh.

To retrieve these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use Query Status to obtain the current temperature (°C) and energy consumption (kWh) of the water heater.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Irrigation Controller
  ***Properties***
    Watering Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        True [1]
        False [0]
    Soil Moisture Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Watering [START]
    Stop Watering [STOP]
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCHED]
      Parameter 1: Schedule Enabled
        Enum
          True [1]
          False [0]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you start watering the garden and enable the watering schedule?

The user wants to start watering and enable the watering schedule. The device accepts Start Watering command without parameters to turn watering On, and Enable Schedule command with a parameter to enable or disable the schedule.

First, the Start Watering command will set Watering Status to On [1]. Then, Enable Schedule with parameter True [1] will enable the schedule.

Result: Execute Start Watering command followed by Enable Schedule with True to meet the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Irrigation Controller
  ***Properties***
    Watering Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        True [1]
        False [0]
    Soil Moisture Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Watering [START]
    Stop Watering [STOP]
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCHED]
      Parameter 1: Schedule Enabled
        Enum
          True [1]
          False [0]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
What is the current soil moisture level and is the watering schedule enabled?

The user wants to know the Soil Moisture Level and whether the watering schedule is enabled. Soil Moisture Level is a percentage from 0 to 100, and Schedule Enabled is an enum True [1] or False [0].

To get these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use Query Status to retrieve Soil Moisture Level (%) and Schedule Enabled (True/False) from the irrigation controller.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Garage Door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Please open the garage door and unlock it.

The user wants to open the garage door and unlock it. The device accepts Open Door command to change Door Status to Open [1], and Unlock Door command to set Lock Status to Unlocked [0].

First, execute Open Door to open the door. Then, execute Unlock Door to unlock it.

Result: Send Open Door command followed by Unlock Door command to fulfill the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Garage Door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
What is the current battery level and door status of the garage door?

The user wants to know the Battery Level and Door Status of the garage door. Battery Level ranges from 0 to 100 percent, and Door Status is an enum with Closed [0] or Open [1].

To retrieve these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use Query Status to obtain Battery Level (%) and Door Status (Closed/Open) of the garage door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Status
      Enum
        Open [0]
        Closed [100]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Shade [OPEN]
    Close Shade [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SET_POS]
      Parameter 1: Position
        Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you close the window shade completely and confirm if it is responding?

The user wants to close the window shade fully and check if it is responding. Closing the shade corresponds to setting Position to 100% or using the Close Shade command. The Responding property indicates True [0] or False [1].

First, execute Close Shade command to close the shade. Then, issue Query Status to check the Responding property.

Result: Send Close Shade command to close the shade, then Query Status to confirm Responding is True or False.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Status
      Enum
        Open [0]
        Closed [100]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Shade [OPEN]
    Close Shade [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SET_POS]
      Parameter 1: Position
        Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Set the window shade to 45 percent open.

The user wants to set the window shade position to 45%, which is within the allowed range of 0 to 100 percent.

The device accepts the Set Position command with a parameter for position percentage.

Result: Execute Set Position command with parameter 45 to set the shade to 45% open.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high.

The user wants to turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high. The device accepts Turn On command to set Power Status to On [1], and Set Fan Speed command with parameter High [3].

First, execute Turn On command. Then, execute Set Fan Speed with High.

Result: Send Turn On command followed by Set Fan Speed (High) to fulfill the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
What is the current air quality index and fan speed of the air purifier?

The user wants to know the Air Quality Index (AQI) and Fan Speed of the air purifier. AQI ranges from 0 to 500, and Fan Speed is an enum with Low [1], Medium [2], and High [3].

To retrieve these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use Query Status to obtain the current Air Quality Index (0-500 AQI) and Fan Speed (Low, Medium, or High) of the air purifier.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 1.0 to 10.0 Unit Celsius
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature
        Range 1.0 to 10.0 Unit Celsius
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and turn it on.

The user wants to set the refrigerator temperature to 4 °C, which is within the allowed range of 1.0 to 10.0 °C, and turn the power on.

First, execute Set Temperature command with parameter 4.0 °C. Then, execute Turn On command to power on the refrigerator.

Result: Send Set Temperature (4.0 °C) followed by Turn On command to fulfill the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 1.0 to 10.0 Unit Celsius
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature
        Range 1.0 to 10.0 Unit Celsius
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Is the refrigerator door open and what is the current temperature?

The user wants to know if the refrigerator door is open and the current temperature. Door Status is an enum with Closed [0] and Open [1], and Temperature ranges from 1.0 to 10.0 °C.

To get these values, the assistant should issue the Query Status command, which will return the current property values.

Result: Use Query Status to retrieve Door Status (Open/Closed) and Temperature (°C) of the refrigerator.
